Material-UI

‰ªÄ‰πàÊòØ Material-UI

Material-UI ÊòØ‰∏ÄÁªÑ React ÁªÑ‰ª∂ÔºåËÆæËÆ°È£éÊ†ºÈááÁî®‰∫Ü Google ÁöÑ Material Design„ÄÇüëç

Áúã‰∏™ÁÆÄÂçïÁöÑÊ†óÂ≠ê:

import React from 'react';
import ReactDOM from 'react-dom';
import Button from '@material-ui/core/Button';

function App() {
  return (
    <Button variant="contained" color="primary">
      Hello World
    </Button>
  );
}

ReactDOM.render(<App />, document.querySelector('#app'));

Icons ÂõæÊ†áÁúãËøôÈáå üëà

JSS

JSS ÂÆûÁé∞‰∫Ü ‚ÄúCSS In JS‚ÄùÔºåÂºïÁî®ÂÆòÊñπÁöÑ‰ªãÁªç:

JSS is a more powerful abstraction over CSS. It uses JavaScript as a language to describe styles in a declarative and maintainable way. It is a high performance JS to CSS compiler which works at runtime and server-side. This core library is low level and framework agnostic. It is about 6KB (minified and gzipped) and is extensible via plugins API.

Material-UI Ê†∑ÂºèËß£ÂÜ≥ÊñπÊ°àÂ∞±ÊòØÈááÂèñ JSS ‰Ωú‰∏∫Ê†∏ÂøÉÔºåÊàë‰ª¨‰ΩøÁî® JSS Âπ∂ÈÄöËøá withStyles ÂàõÂª∫ÁöÑÈ´òÈò∂ÁªÑ‰ª∂Â∞Ü styles Êï∞ÁªÑÊ≥®ÂÖ•Âà∞ DOM ‰∏≠‰Ωú‰∏∫ CSS Ê†∑ÂºèÔºåÂ¶Ç‰∏ã:

// 1. We define the styles.
const styles = {
  root: {
    flexGrow: 1,
  },
  flex: {
    flexGrow: 1,
  },
  menuButton: {
    marginLeft: -12,
    marginRight: 20,
  },
}

// Ê†∑ÂºèÈÄöËøáÂØπË±°ÁöÑÂΩ¢ÂºèËÆøÈóÆ
// 2. ÈÄöËøá‰øÆÈ•∞Âô®Ê≥®ÂÖ•Ê†∑Âºè @withStyles(styles)
function ButtonAppBar(props) {
  const { classes } = props; // Ëé∑Âèñ props ÈáåÁöÑ classes Â±ûÊÄß
  return (
    <div className={classes.root}>
      <AppBar position="static">
        <Toolbar>
          <IconButton className={classes.menuButton} color="inherit" aria-label="Menu">
            <MenuIcon />
          </IconButton>
          <Typography variant="title" color="inherit" className={classes.flex}>
            News
          </Typography>
          <Button color="inherit">Login</Button>
        </Toolbar>
      </AppBar>
    </div>
  );
}

// 2. We inject the styles.
export default withStyles(styles)(ButtonAppBar);

È´òÈò∂ÁªÑ‰ª∂(HOC)Â∞±ÊòØ‰∏Ä‰∏™ÂáΩÊï∞Ôºå‰∏îËØ•ÂáΩÊï∞Êé•Âèó‰∏Ä‰∏™ÁªÑ‰ª∂‰Ωú‰∏∫ÂèÇÊï∞ÔºåÂπ∂ËøîÂõû‰∏Ä‰∏™Êñ∞ÁöÑÁªÑ‰ª∂:

const EnhancedComponent = higherOrderComponent(WrappedComponent);

jss-nested

ÈÄöËøá jss-nested ÂèØ‰ª•ÊîØÊåÅÁ±ª‰ºº less ‰∏≠ÂµåÂ•óÁöÑÂÜôÊ≥ï:

// Use & to reference selector of the parent rule.
const styles = {
  container: {
    padding: 20,
    '&:hover': {
      background: 'blue'
    },
    // Add a global .clear class to the container.
    '&.clear': {
      clear: 'both'
    },
    // Reference a global .button scoped to the container.
    '& .button': {
      background: 'red'
    },
    // Use multiple container refs in one selector
    '&.selected, &.active': {
      border: '1px solid red'
    }
  }
}

// Use $ruleName to reference a local rule within the same style sheet.
const styles = {
  container: {
    // Reference the local rule "button".
    '& $button': {
      padding: '10px'
    },
    // Multiple local refs in one rule.
    '&:hover $button, &:active $button': {
      color: 'red',
    },
    '&:focus $button': {
      color: 'blue'
    }
  },
  button: {
    color: 'grey'
  }
}

const styles = {
  button: {
    color: 'red',
    '@media (min-width: 1024px)': {
      width: 200
    }
  }
}

classnames

ÂΩìÊúâÂ§ö‰∏™Ê†∑ÂºèÁªÑÂêàÊó∂ÔºåÂèØ‰ª•ÈááÁî®Ëøô‰∏™Â∫ì classnames:

import classNames from 'classnames'

...
<Paper
  elevation={0}
  className={classNames(
    classes.paperPadding,
    classes.paperBorder,
    'recommend-con', // ‰πüÂèØ‰ª•Áõ¥Êé•ÂÜôÁ±ªÂêç
  )}
>

<Paper
  className={classNames(isParent
    ? classes.samplePaper
    : classes.samplePaperDisabled, {
    [classes.paperShadow]: prop.style.type === style.type,
  })}
>

Theme ‰∏ªÈ¢ò

ËøôÈáåÁõÆÂâçÂè™ËÆ®ËÆ∫ÈªòËÆ§‰∏ªÈ¢òÁöÑÊÉÖÂÜµÔºåÈªòËÆ§ÁöÑÂÖ®ÈÉ®Ê†∑ÂºèÂèØÊü•ÁúãËøôÈáå:

// theme.spacing.unit ÈªòËÆ§‰∏∫ 8
const styles = theme => ({
  root: {
    padding: theme.spacing.unit * 2,
    paddingTop: 0,
    backgroundColor: theme.palette.type === 'light' ? theme.palette.common.white : '#242424',
    minHeight: theme.spacing.unit * 40,
    width: '100%',
  },
  switch: {
    paddingBottom: theme.spacing.unit,
  },
});

Â¶ÇÊûúÈúÄË¶ÅËá™ÂÆö‰πâ‰∏ªÈ¢òÔºåÈúÄË¶Å‰ΩøÁî® MuiThemeProvider ÁªÑ‰ª∂Êù•Ê≥®ÂÖ•Âà∞Â∫îÁî®‰∏≠ÔºåÂÖ∑‰ΩìÊü•ÁúãËøôÈáå üëà

overrides

When the configuration variables aren‚Äôt powerful enough, you can take advantage of the overrides key of the theme to potentially change every single style injected by Material-UI into the DOM. That‚Äôs a really powerful feature.

const theme = createMuiTheme({
  overrides: {
    // Name of the component / style sheet
    MuiButton: {
      // Name of the rule
      root: {
        // Some CSS
        background: 'linear-gradient(45deg, #FE6B8B 30%, #FF8E53 90%)',
        borderRadius: 3,
        border: 0,
        color: 'white',
        height: 48,
        padding: '0 30px',
        boxShadow: '0 3px 5px 2px rgba(255, 105, 135, .3)',
      },
    },
  },
});

function OverridesCss() {
  return (
    <MuiThemeProvider theme={theme}>
      <Button>Overrides CSS</Button>
    </MuiThemeProvider>
  );
}

props

You can also apply properties on all the instances of a component type. We expose a props key in the theme for this use case.

const theme = createMuiTheme({
  props: {
    // Name of the component
    MuiButtonBase: {
      // The properties to apply
      disableRipple: true, // No more ripple, on the whole application üí£!
    },
  },
});

Ê†∑Âºè‰∏éÂ∏ÉÂ±Ä

CSS Baseline

CSS Baseline Â¶ÇÂêå normalize.cssÔºåÊòØÂ±û‰∫é HTML ÂÖÉÁ¥†ÂíåÂ±ûÊÄßÊ†∑ÂºèÊ†áÂáÜÂåñÁöÑ‰∏Ä‰∏™ÈõÜÂêà:

import React from 'react';
import CssBaseline from '@material-ui/core/CssBaseline';

function MyApp() {
  return (
    <React.Fragment>
      <CssBaseline />
      {/* The rest of your application */}
    </React.Fragment>
  );
}

Typography

API ÂèØÊü•ÁúãËøôÈáåÔºåÂ∏∏Áî®ÁöÑÂ±ûÊÄß:

Â±ûÊÄß Á±ªÂûã ÈªòËÆ§ÂÄº ÊèèËø∞
children node ¬† ÈÄöÁî®Â±ûÊÄß„ÄÇThe content of the component.
classes object ¬† ÈÄöÁî®Â±ûÊÄß„ÄÇOverride or extend the styles applied to the component. See CSS API below for more details.
component union: string„ÄÅfunc„ÄÅobject ‚Äòdiv‚Äô ÈÄöÁî®Â±ûÊÄß„ÄÇThe component used for the root node. Either a string to use a DOM element or a component.
align enum: ‚Äòinherit‚Äô, ‚Äòleft‚Äô, ‚Äòcenter‚Äô, ‚Äòright‚Äô, ‚Äòjustify‚Äô ‚Äòinherit‚Äô Set the text-align on the component.
color enum: ‚Äòdefault‚Äô, ‚Äòerror‚Äô, ‚Äòinherit‚Äô, ‚Äòprimary‚Äô, ‚Äòsecondary‚Äô, ‚ÄòtextPrimary‚Äô, ‚ÄòtextSecondary‚Äô ‚Äòdefault‚Äô The color of the component. It supports those theme colors that make sense for this component.
gutterBottom bool false If true, the text will have a bottom margin.
noWrap bool false If true, the text will not wrap, but instead will truncate with an ellipsis.
paragraph bool false If true, the text will have a bottom margin.
variant enum: ‚Äòdisplay4‚Ä¶1‚Äô, ‚Äòheadline‚Äô, ‚Äòtitle‚Äô, ‚Äòsubheading‚Äô, ‚Äòbody2‚Ä¶1‚Äô, ‚Äòcaption‚Äô, ‚Äòbutton‚Äô ‚Äòbody1‚Äô Applies the theme typography styles.

Grid

Grid Â±û‰∫éÂìçÂ∫îÂºèÂ∏ÉÂ±ÄÔºåMaterial Design‚Äôs responsive UI is based on a 12-column grid layout:

function CenteredGrid(props) {
  const { classes } = props;

  return (
    <div className={classes.root}>
      <Grid container spacing={24}>
        <Grid item xs={12}>
          <Paper className={classes.paper}>xs=12</Paper>
        </Grid>
        <Grid item xs={6}>
          <Paper className={classes.paper}>xs=6</Paper>
        </Grid>
        <Grid item xs={6}>
          <Paper className={classes.paper}>xs=6</Paper>
        </Grid>
        <Grid item xs={3}>
          <Paper className={classes.paper}>xs=3</Paper>
        </Grid>
        ...
      </Grid>
    </div>
  )
}

Ê≥®ÊÑè‰∏äËø∞ÁöÑÂ±ûÊÄßÔºåË¶Å‰∏é CSS API Âå∫ÂàÜÂºÄ„ÄÇ‰ΩøÁî®ÂÆÉÂèØ‰ª•Ë¶ÜÁõñÁªÑ‰ª∂ÂÜÖÁöÑ‰∏Ä‰∫õÊ†∑Âºè

CSS API

‰∏æ‰∏™ Dialog ÁªÑ‰ª∂ CSS API ÁöÑÁ§∫‰æã:

ÂêçÁß∞ ÊèèËø∞
paper Styles applied to the Paper component. 
<Dialog
  disableBackdropClick
  open={open}
  onClose={this.handleClose}
  maxWidth={false}
  classes={ { // Ê≥®ÊÑèËøôÈáåÁöÑÂÜôÊ≥ï
    paper: classes.dialogPaper, // ÂèØ‰ª•Ë¶ÜÁõñ Dialog ÂÜÖÁöÑ paper ÁªÑ‰ª∂Ê†∑Âºè
  } }
>

Â∏∏Áî®ÁªÑ‰ª∂

Button

Â±ûÊÄß Á±ªÂûã ÈªòËÆ§ÂÄº ÊèèËø∞
color enum: ‚Äòdefault‚Äô„ÄÅ‚Äôinherit‚Äô„ÄÅ‚Äôprimary‚Äô„ÄÅ‚Äôsecondary‚Äô ‚Äòdefault‚Äô The color of the component. It supports those theme colors that make sense for
disabled bool false If true, the button will be disabled.
fullWidth bool false If true, the button will take up the full width of its container.
mini bool false If true, and variant is ‚Äòfab‚Äô, will use mini floating action button styling.
size enum: ‚Äòsmall‚Äô„ÄÅ‚Äômedium‚Äô„ÄÅ‚Äôlarge‚Äô ‚Äòmedium‚Äô The size of the button. small is equivalent to the dense button styling.
variant enum: ‚Äòtext‚Äô, ‚Äòflat‚Äô, ‚Äòoutlined‚Äô, ‚Äòcontained‚Äô, ‚Äòraised‚Äô, ‚Äòfab‚Äô, ‚ÄòextendedFab‚Äô ‚Äòtext‚Äô The variant to use.

Dialog

Â±ûÊÄß Á±ªÂûã ÈªòËÆ§ÂÄº ÊèèËø∞
fullScreen bool false If true, the dialog will be full-screen
fullWidth bool false If true, the dialog stretches to maxWidth.
open bool ¬† If true, the Dialog is open.
onClose func ¬† Callback fired when the component requests to be closed.
disableBackdropClick bool false If true, clicking the backdrop will not fire the onClose callback.
disableEscapeKeyDown bool false If true, hitting escape will not fire the onClose callback.
onEnter func ¬† Callback fired before the dialog enters.
scroll enum: ‚Äòbody‚Äô„ÄÅ‚Äôpaper‚Äô ‚Äòpaper‚Äô Determine the container for scrolling the dialog.
TransitionComponent union: string„ÄÅfunc„ÄÅobject Fade Transition component.
transitionDuration union: number„ÄÅ{ enter?: number, exit?: number } { enter: duration.enteringScreen, exit: duration.leavingScreen } The duration for the transition, in milliseconds. You may specify a single timeout for all transitions, or individually with an object.

Paper

Â±ûÊÄß Á±ªÂûã ÈªòËÆ§ÂÄº ÊèèËø∞
elevation number 2 Shadow depth, corresponds to dp in the spec. It‚Äôs accepting values between 0 and 24 inclusive.
square bool false If true, rounded corners are disabled. 
<div>
  <Paper className={classes.root} elevation={1}>
    <Typography variant="headline" component="h3">
      This is a sheet of paper.
    </Typography>
    <Typography component="p">
      Paper can be used to build surface or other elements for your application.
    </Typography>
  </Paper>
</div>
